column4: anyone - had xp/ubuntu installed, installed vista - now cant seem to get grub to work, tried reinstalling it from live cd but it just boots to windows everytime... any ideas?
just pop your ubuntu liveCD in, and setup grub in your MBR again
well i guess the last answer is just to reinstall ubuntu, not the end of the world, but id rather just fixt it
jester - ive tried that like 3 or 4 times, still no go, but that is what i keep reading
grub, when you're in the prompt : root (hd0,0) then setup (hd0,0)
hmm
jester - yep did that, im just thinking it must be some small thing im missing
it boots straight into windows without seeing grub? then grub isn't installed properly in the mbr
only Windows boot code in the MBR can point to the Windows boot sector and system partition
wasnt really worried about windows eating grub, fixed it before, just cant seem to get it to work now
what is your bootable hard drive ?
jester - drive w/windows on it
jester - xp
but how does it appear in linux, hd0 ?
err I mean, /dev/hda ?
i believe a running process is actively using cpu cycles
- one that is not using cycles
- at that moment
well my guess is you're setting up grub on a partition instead of the mbr (setup (hd0,0) instead of setup (hd0)) for example, or just on the wrong hard drive. Anyways gl
jester - /dev/hda1 is boot
should be hd0 in grub then, you can see the partitions with tab
